Plagiarism Detectors


 

Academic Plagiarism and Cheating


 

Plagiarism






How do plagiarism detectors work?


UpdateCancel



















ad  by Grammarly

You dismissed this ad.

Undo



Answer Wiki



1 Answer


 




 

Vaibhav Agrawal, The Bakchod Engineer .. xD
Answered 96w ago













Plagiarism detection is the process of locating instances of plagiarism within a work or document. The widespread use of computers and the advent of the Internet has made it easier to plagiarize the work of others. Most cases of plagiarism are found in academia, where documents are typically essays or reports. However, plagiarism can be found in virtually any field, including novels, scientific papers, art designs, and source code.
Detection of plagiarism can be either manual or software-assisted. Manual detection requires substantial effort and excellent memory, and is impractical in cases where too many documents must be compared, or original documents are not available for comparison. Software-assisted detection allows vast collections of documents to be compared to each other, making successful detection much more likely.
Source : Plagiarism detection - Wikipedia

<div id="__w2_wnyftHvw9_answer_content"><div class="ExpandedContent ExpandedAnswer" id="__w2_wnyftHvw13_expanded_content"><div id="wnyftHvw16"></div>
<div class="TranslatedAnswerBanner"></div>
<div class="u-serif-font-main--large"><div class="ui_qtext_expanded"><span class="ui_qtext_rendered_qtext"><p class="ui_qtext_para"><b>Plagiarism detection</b> is the process of locating instances of <span class="qlink_container"><a class="external_link" data-qt-tooltip="wikipedia.org" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plagiarism" onclick="return Q.openUrl(this, 37191692);" rel="noopener nofollow" target="_blank">plagiarism</a></span> within a work or document. The widespread use of computers and the advent of the Internet has made it easier to plagiarize the work of others. Most cases of plagiarism are found in academia, where documents are typically essays or reports. However, plagiarism can be found in virtually any field, including novels, scientific papers, art designs, and source code.</p>
<p class="ui_qtext_para">Detection of plagiarism can be either manual or software-assisted. Manual detection requires substantial effort and excellent memory, and is impractical in cases where too many documents must be compared, or original documents are not available for comparison. Software-assisted detection allows vast collections of documents to be compared to each other, making successful detection much more likely.</p>
<p class="ui_qtext_para">Source : <span class="qlink_container"><a class="external_link" data-qt-tooltip="wikipedia.org" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plagiarism_detection" onclick="return Q.openUrl(this, 37191692);" rel="noopener nofollow" target="_blank">Plagiarism detection - Wikipedia</a></span></p>
</span></div>
</div>
